meanings.sent1: The teacher dismissed the student's balderdashes during class.
meanings.sent2: I don't have time for your balderdashes right now.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's balderdashes had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His explanation was just a bunch of balderdashes that no one believed.
meanings.sent5: The book was full of balderdashes that made it hard to follow the plot.

meanings.sent1: She could see through his balderdashes and knew he was lying.
meanings.sent2: Don't listen to his balderdashes; he's just trying to confuse you.
meanings.sent3: The children's game was filled with playful balderdashes.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were like balderdashes floating in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech was a whirlwind of balderdashes and empty promises.
